page.title: 15Westbury Court Home
page.content: Westbury Court Home for the Elderly is on the A48 between the village church and the National Trust property of Westbury Court Gardens. The Home, administered by the Gloucs County Council replaced the old Westbury Workhouse. The residents have individually furnished rooms, double or single, on two floors of the building. The warden in charge is assisted by a very caring staff. The wide front entrance leads to offices, domestic, dining and large social rooms. There are also smaller rooms where guests can be welcomed privately This year of 1985 has seen the whole building re-roofed. This clean, bright Home is set in the surrounds of lawns, flower borders and garden furniture and the elderly can walk around the Dutch gardens. The Home also possesses a Minibus for outings.
